meanings.definition: A yellow pigment found in plants and animals.
meanings.sent1: The lutea in the flower petals gives them their bright yellow color.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the lutea in leaves to understand photosynthesis better.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar accidentally turned yellow after eating too much lutea-rich food!
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was like a canvas filled with lutea, bringing warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The lutea in the sunset painted the sky in shades of gold and amber.

meanings.sent1: The lutea dress she wore matched the sunshine outside.
meanings.sent2: The ripe bananas had a lutea hue that signaled they were ready to eat.
meanings.sent3: The lutea walls of the house made it stand out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as bright and lutea as the summer sun.
meanings.sent5: The lutea glow of the fireflies lit up the garden at night.
